title: H2O2 Ecell - sign of delta G and magnitude of K

content.description: The equation and standard cell potential for the decomposition of H2O2(aq) in acidic solution at 25Â°C is given above. The reduction half-reactions for the process are listed below.
content.question: Which of the following is true for the decomposition of H2O2(aq)?

choices.label: delta G naught is greater than 0 and K e q is greater than 1
delta G naught is greater than 0 and K e q is less than 1
delta G naught is less than 0 and K e q is greater than 1
delta G naught is less than 0 and K e q is less than 1

content.answer: delta G naught is less than 0 and K e q is greater than 1

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
